top_categories.workout_context: OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)’s mississippi hills, southern gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)’s mississippi hills gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of OMG (Oxford MS Gravel). Make this intensity feel like home.
Racing OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The varied gradients at OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Every session at OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)’s mississippi hills gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
High-volume endurance builds the aerobic base that makes OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)’s race-day efforts sustainable rather than destructive.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mississippi hills gravel to build confidence. Expect: mississippi hills, southern gravel, southeast us.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 50 miles of mississippi hills gravel in Oxford, MS.
